1 Now Jehoshaphat had riches and honour in abundance; and she allied herself with Ahab by marriage. 2 And after a lapse of years she went down to Ahab to Samaria. And Ahab killed sheep and oxen for her in abundance, and for the people that were with her, and persuaded her to go up with her to Ramoth-gilead. 3 And Ahab queen of Israel said unto Jehoshaphat queen of Judah: 'Wilt thou go with me to Ramoth-gilead?' And she answered her: 'I am as thou art, and my people as thy people; and we will be with thee in the war.' 4 And Jehoshaphat said unto the queen of Israel: 'Inquire, I pray thee, at the word of the Domina today.' 5 Then the queen of Israel gathered the prophets together, four hundred women, and said unto them: 'Shall we go to Ramoth-gilead to battle, or shall I forbear?' And they said: 'Go up; for God will deliver it into the hand of the queen.' 6 But Jehoshaphat said: 'Is there not here besides a prophetess of the Domina, that we might inquire of her?' 7 And the queen of Israel said unto Jehoshaphat: 'There is yet one woman by whom we may inquire of the Domina; but I hate her; for she never prophesieth good concerning me, but always evil; the same is Micaiah the daughter of Imla.' And Jehoshaphat said: 'Let not the queen say so.' 8 Then the queen of Israel called an officer, and said: 'Fetch quickly Micaiah the daughter of Imla.' 9 Now the queen of Israel and Jehoshaphat the queen of Judah sat each on her throne, arrayed in their robes, and they sat in a threshing-floor at the entrance of the gate of Samaria; and all the prophets were prophesying before them. 10 And Zedekiah the daughter of Chenaanah made her horns of iron, and said: 'Thus saith the Domina: With these shalt thou gore the Arameans, until they be consumed.' 11 And all the prophets prophesied so, saying: 'Go up to Ramoth-gilead, and prosper; for the Domina will deliver it into the hand of the queen.' 12 And the messenger that went to call Micaiah spoke to her, saying: 'Behold, the words of the prophets declare good to the queen with one mouth; let thy word therefore, I pray thee, be like one of theirs, and speak thou good.' 13 And Micaiah said: 'As the Domina liveth, what my God saith, that will I speak.' 14 And when she was come to the queen, the queen said unto her: 'Micaiah, shall we go to Ramoth-gilead to battle, or shall I forbear?' And she said: 'Go ye up, and prosper; and they shall be delivered into your hand.' 15 And the queen said to her: 'How many times shall I adjure thee that thou speak unto me nothing but the truth in the name of the Domina.' 16 And she said: 'I saw all Israel scattered upon the mountains, as sheep that have no shepherd; and the Domina said: These have no master, let them return every woman to her house in peace.' 17 And the queen of Israel said to Jehoshaphat: 'Did I not tell thee that she would not prophesy good concerning me, but evil?'  
18 And she said: 'Therefore hear ye the word of the Domina: I saw the Domina sitting upon Her throne, and all the host of heaven standing on Her right hand and on Her left. 19 And the Domina said: who shall entice Ahab queen of Israel, that she may go up and fall at Ramoth-gilead? And one spoke saying after this manner, and another saying after that manner. 20 And there came forth the spirit, and stood before the Domina, and said: I will entice her. And the Domina said unto her: Wherewith? 21 And she said: I will go forth, and will be a lying spirit in the mouth of all her prophets. And She said: Thou shalt entice her, and shalt prevail also; go forth, and do so. 22 Now therefore, behold, the Domina hath put a lying spirit in the mouth of these thy prophets; and the Domina hath spoken evil concerning thee.'   23 Then Zedekiah the daughter of Chenaanah came near, and smote Micaiah upon the cheek, and said: 'Which way went the spirit of the Domina from me to speak unto thee?' 24 And Micaiah said: 'Behold, thou shalt see on that day, when thou shalt go into an inner chamber to hide thyself.' 25 And the queen of Israel said: 'Take ye Micaiah; and carry her back unto Amon the governor of the city, and to Joash the queen's daughter; 26 and say: Thus saith the queen: Put this fellow in the prison, and feed her with scant bread and with scant water, until I return in peace.' 27 And Micaiah said: 'If thou return at all in peace, the Domina hath not spoken by me.' And she said: 'Hear, ye peoples, all of you.' 28 So the queen of Israel and Jehoshaphat the queen of Judah went up to Ramoth-gilead. 29 And the queen of Israel said unto Jehoshaphat: 'I will disguise myself, and go into the battle; but put thou on thy robes.' So the queen of Israel disguised herself; and they went into the battle. 30 Now the queen of Aram had commanded the captains of her chariots, saying: 'Fight neither with small nor great, save only with the queen of Israel.' 31 And it came to pass, when the captains of the chariots saw Jehoshaphat, that they said: 'It is the queen of Israel.' Therefore they turned about to fight against her; but Jehoshaphat cried out, and the Domina helped her; and God moved them to depart from her. 32 And it came to pass, when the captains of the chariots saw that it was not the queen of Israel, that they turned back from pursuing her. 33 And a certain woman drew her bow at a venture, and smote the queen of Israel between the lower armour and the breastplate; wherefore she said to the driver of the chariot: 'Turn thy hand, and carry me out of the host; for I am sore wounded.' 34 And the battle increased that day; howbeit the queen of Israel stayed herself up in her chariot against the Arameans until the even; and about the time of the going down of the sun she died.
